evidence: Text mostly readable with proper discourse on shoes and Kantian aesthetics. Contains word fragments: 'uct' (product), 'mainder' (remainder). Foreign terms (ergon, parergon, auf, bloss, Dienlichkeit, hors-d'oeuvre) are correct and not errors.

Clear, readable text discussing Heidegger's interpretation. Minor artifact 'degger' is part of Heidegger name handling. German term 'desoeuvrementj' appears to have spurious 'j' but context is clear. Overall high quality OCR.
Readable discussion of painting and frame theory. Clear errors: 'nake' (should be naked), 'pierc' (piercing). Foreign terms pointure, chaussee correctly captured. Footnote marker '1nake' is expected.

Generally readable text with discussion of peasant shoes and Schapiro's objection. Error: 'biiuerin' (should be Bäuerin, German peasant woman). French terms (inconnu, Balzac) correct. German phrases properly captured.

Well-preserved multilingual text with German and French passages. No clear OCR errors. Terms like 'Bauernschuhe' (peasant shoes), 'dinghafte' (thingness), correctly captured. Discussion is coherent and readable.

Text discusses monoreferentialism and painting analysis. Several word fragments visible: 'ential' (referential), 'Veranschaulichung' partially preserved. German philosophical terms present. Readable with effort, ~3-4 minor errors across discussion.

Text readable with philosophical discussion. Clear errors: 'ondary' (secondary), 'imi' fragments, 'pompes' seems out of context but appears intentional in original (slang for shoes). Overall structure preserved.

High-quality OCR with clear, readable philosophical text. Technical terms preserved: 'detachables', 'citationality', 'usure' (wear/usury - French pun). Discussion of Magritte's 'Le Modèle rouge' is coherent and well-captured.

Multiple significant OCR errors impair readability: 'vne' (one), 'jjty' (garbled), 'lnassive' (massive), 'deternlinable' (determinable). These are character-level errors, not foreign language or footnote markers. Text becomes difficult to parse without context.

Significant OCR degradation: 'oiw' (corrupted Greek homoiosis), 'ible' fragments, 'sentative' (representative), 'repre' incomplete, 'mea' context unclear. Page appears to have OCR confidence issues. Multiple character substitutions and omissions.

Well-preserved philosophical text with clear discourse on shoes, propriety and belonging. Minor artifact 'identifi' but context fully recoverable. German words (dunkeln, Offnung, ausgetretenen) correctly preserved. Quotations intact.

Readable discussion of Schapiro's argument and framing debate. Minor artifact 'eilde' (Eilde/image) but recoverable from context. French term 'portees' (implications) correct. Overall high-quality capture of complex philosophical argument.

Clear philosophical text with proper handling of German terms: 'erkliirung' (explanation with umlaut), 'Gemiilde' (painting), 'Schuhzeuges' (shoe-product), 'brachten' (brought). Quotations and translations properly rendered.

Text readable with some OCR artifacts. German compound 'geziige' appears intentionally (traits/features). Footnote reference to lacet expected. Minor issues in technical terminology but overall discourse recoverable.

Readable philosophical discussion with clear argumentation. Minor fragment 'erration' recoverable from context. French terms 'peasanthood', philosophical vocabulary well-preserved. Argument structure intact and followable.

Text readable but contains 2 clear errors: 'neyed' (honeyed), 'expli' (explications). Discussion of close reading and textual interpretation is coherent. French phrases present. Overall manageable despite errors.

Mostly readable text with clear philosophical argument about uselessness and pictorial reference. Error: 'sehenn' (double-n, should be sehen). German terms like 'Aber', 'wir', 'schon' correctly preserved. Winding road metaphor intact.

Despite high reported error rate (11.8%), page remains largely readable due to multilingual content. Errors: 'schap' (Schapiro), 'eidung' (Kleidung-clothing). French 'paysans', German botanical terms present. Readable with knowledge of context.
Short caption page with minimal text: image titles for Van Gogh still life paintings. Only word present is 'etc' as abbreviation, which is correct. Perfect OCR for the limited content.

Readable discussion of painting and interpretation. German and French properly mixed: 'seinem' (his), 'Fussbekleidung' (foot clothing), 'entrouvert' (half-open). Multilingual handling is good. Quotations intact.

Clear philosophical text with complex discussion of marking and reattachment. French term 'abyme' (abyss) correct. German 'gibt' (gives) preserved. Overall readable with sophisticated argument structure intact.

Readable text with one clear error: 'itjt' character noise. French terms preserved: 'souliers' (shoes), 'parergon', 'stricturation'. Philosophical discourse on frame and shoes is coherent and mostly well-captured.

Excellent OCR quality with sophisticated philosophical text on detachment and reattachment. Artifact 'iiread' is expected footnote marker (double 'i'). Terms like 'fetishization', 'interlacing' properly captured. High readability.

Clear discussion of painting requirement and Schapiro's views. French 'pensee' (thought) correct. German 'Verlasslichkeit' (reliability) well-preserved. Discourse on stepping back and shoes is coherent and readable.

Well-preserved multilingual text with Latin 'fidem' and French 'revient' correctly captured. Discussion of fidelity and reliability is clear. References to Panofsky and Exodus properly handled. Philosophical argument intact.
